properties.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued February 6 at 8:03AM HST until February 6 at 11:15AM HST by NWS Honolulu HI
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in Honolulu has extended the

* Flash Flood Warning for...
The island of Kauai in Kauai County

* Until 1115 AM HST.

* At 801 AM HST, the Hanalei River Gage continues to be well above
threshold levels. Flooding is observed along Kuhio Highway near
the Hanalei Bridge and the road is closed. Rainfall continues in
the area, which will help to keep the water levels high over the
next several hours. High water levels are also expected in
Hanakapiai Stream, Kawaikoi Stream, and the Wainiha River.

HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain.

SOURCE...Emergency management.

IMPACT...Flooding in drainages, streams, rivers, roads,
properties, and other low-lying areas. Public road
closures possible in some areas. Landslides are possible
in steep terrain.

* Some locations that will experience flooding include...
Princeville, Wainiha, North Fork Wailua Trails, Hanalei and Na Pali
State Park.
properties.instruction:
A Flash Flood Warning means that flooding is imminent or occurring
within the warned area.

Stay away from streams, rivers, drainage ditches, and culverts, even
if they are currently dry.

Do not cross fast flowing water in your vehicle, or on foot. Turn
around, don't drown.
